intro: Galium brenanii, commonly known as Brenan's bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features slender, sprawling stems covered in fine hairs, and its small, white flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. Galium brenanii typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes.
